reference.title: screen
reference.shortdesc: The <screen> element contains or refers to a textual representation of a computer screen or user interface panel (window).

section.p: Use <screen> to contain representations of text-based online panels, text consoles ("term" or "curses" windows, for example), or other text-based user interface components. The default print representation is to enclose the screen within a box, suggesting a computer display screen. In contrast to graphical screen captures normally used to represent GUI parts (see the image element description), this element specifically supports constructions for which text is the primary content.
This element is part of the DITA user interface domain, a special set of DITA elements designed to document user interface tasks, concepts and reference information.
